Getting Started with ultragsea

BigOmics Analytics

Source: vignettes/01_getting_started.Rmd
01_getting_started.Rmd

Introduction

ultragsea is a novel, ultrafast and memory optimized gene set enrichment scoring algorithm not unlike fGSEA. ultragsea demonstrates highly correlated gene set scores and p-values and typically is 100 times faster than fGSEA.

Example

Preparing gensets

For this vignette, our package includes a small subset of the the pmbc3k single-cell dataset of just 50 cells. Please install the Seurat and SeuratData packages if you want to run this vignette against the full dataset.

library("ultragsea")
library("msigdbr")
gs <- msigdbr::msigdbr(collection = "H")
gmt <- tapply(gs$gene_symbol,gs$gs_name,list)
length(gmt)
#> [1] 50

Performing the statistical test 

G <- gmt2mat(gmt)
fc <- rnorm(nrow(G))
names(fc) <- rownames(G)
res <- ultragsea(fc, G, format='as.gsea', method='ztest')
head(res)
#>                               pathway      pval      padj log2err    ES
#>                                <char>     <num>     <num>   <num> <num>
